PageTitle: display ip routing-table protocol direct sub-protocol
FuncDef: The display ip routing-table protocol direct sub-protocol command displays the information about sub-protocol routes of direct routes. The display ip routing-table protocol direct sub-protocol command displays the information about sub-protocol routes of direct routes.
CLIs: display ip routing-table [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ] protocoldirectsub-protocol { vlink | vlink-trm } [ verbose | inactive ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about the routing table of an IPv4 address family-enabled VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces. The VPN instance name cannot be _public_. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

Displays routes of a specified protocol.
-

Displays the information about sub-protocol routes of direct routes.
-

Displays the information about Vlink direct routes.
-

Displays the information about Vlink-TRM direct routes.
-

Displays detailed information about active and inactive routes.
-

Displays the summary of inactive routes only.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display ip routing-table protocol direct sub-protocol vlink
ExtraInfo:
In the command output, each line indicates a route. The contents include the destination address, mask length, protocol, priority, route cost, route flag, next hop, and outbound interface.
This command without verbose specified displays the preferred routes only.
